faq.calorieQ1: How do I set my daily calorie goal?
faq.calorieA1: Your daily calorie goal can be set in the "Calculator" section based on your personal information and activity level. You can also manually adjust it in "Daily Goals" or "Personal Info" in settings.
faq.calorieQ2: How accurate are the calorie counts?
faq.calorieA2: Calorie counts are based on standard nutritional databases. While generally accurate, slight variations may occur due to food preparation methods or specific product differences.
faq.calorieQ3: Can I track calories for custom foods?
faq.calorieA3: Yes, you can add custom foods with their nutritional information in the "Add Food" screen. This allows you to track homemade meals or unique products not found in our database.
faq.calorieQ4: What happens if I go over my calorie goal?
faq.calorieA4: Going over your calorie goal occasionally is normal. The app will highlight this, but consistent overconsumption may hinder your progress towards weight management goals.
faq.calorieA5: Net carbs are calculated by subtracting fiber and sugar alcohols from total carbohydrates. This is particularly useful for low-carb diets like Keto.
faq.calorieQ6: Can I see my calorie intake history?
faq.calorieA6: Yes, your calorie intake history is available in the "Progress" or "Stats" section, where you can view daily, weekly, and monthly summaries of your consumption.
faq.workoutQ1: How do I create a new workout plan?
faq.workoutA1: You can create a new workout plan from the "Workout" tab. Select "My Workout Plans" and then tap the "+" button to start building your custom routine by adding exercises.
faq.workoutA2: Currently, you can only select from the predefined exercise database. We are working on adding functionality for custom exercise creation in future updates.
faq.workoutQ3: How do I track sets and reps during a workout?
faq.workoutA3: During an active workout session, you can tap on each set to mark it as complete. You can also log the reps and weight for each set.
faq.calculatorA1: BMR (Basal Metabolic Rate) is the calories your body burns at rest. TDEE (Total Daily Energy Expenditure) is the total calories you burn in a day, including activity. The calculator uses these to estimate your needs.
faq.calculatorQ2: How accurate is the calorie calculator?
faq.calculatorA2: The calculator provides an estimate based on standard formulas. Individual results may vary. It's a good starting point, but adjust based on your progress.
faq.mealPlannerQ1: How does the meal planner work?
faq.mealPlannerA1: The meal planner generates daily meal plans based on your calorie and protein targets, considering your dietary preferences and excluded foods. It aims to provide balanced meals.
faq.mealPlannerQ2: Can I customize generated meal plans?
faq.mealPlannerA2: Yes, after a plan is generated, you can view its details and manually adjust food items or portions before saving it to your diary.
faq.othersQ1: How do I change the app language?
faq.othersA1: You can change the app language in the "Settings" screen under the "Language" option. Note that changing the language direction (e.g., English to Arabic) may require an app restart.
faq.othersQ2: Is my data synced across devices?
faq.othersA2: Yes, your data is stored securely in the cloud and synced across all devices where you are logged in with the same account.
